job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description:
LinkSquares is the leading AI-powered Contract Lifecycle Management software suite that helps legal teams optimize contract creation, execution, and analysis. We are dedicated to providing tools to help enable legal teams to provide a higher, faster level of service to their business counterparts, and to drive deals and accelerate revenue. Our business is growing at unprecedented rates. Today we are an established startup with a 100 person team looking to find our next 100 teammates. As a company, we’re customer and sales-driven in every technical decision we make.
We are looking for a smart, friendly, and dedicated Machine Learning Engineer to help build and maintain our ML pipelines. As a Machine Learning Engineer working within the Data Science team at LinkSquares, you will productionize, deploy, and maintain machine learning systems that help our customers understand their contracts. You will work with a wide range of structured and unstructured data sources. You will design and build customized, large-scale cloud-based machine learning systems. You will have a close relationship with our Product Managers and UX Designers, collaborating in a small-team environment.
LinkSquares is a high growth start-up company with an established customer base. As the company grows, the opportunity for you to grow professionally will come at an accelerated pace!
Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent technical experience
1+ years industry experience in a software developer/engineer or machine learning engineer role
Strong Python skills and experience with Python data stack (pandas, numpy, etc.) with knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming
Backend development experience with a strong interest in work involving data pipelines, distributed systems, performance analysis, and/or large-scale data processing
Experience with AWS cloud infrastructure, or a strong desire to become an expert
Fluency in SQL and Database Management
Experience with software engineering practices (e.g. Agile, unit testing, code reviews, design documentation)
Understanding of the ML lifecycle a plus data preprocessing, modeling, training, evaluation, and edge/cloud inference
A self-starter mentality who can own projects end-to-end, from requirements, scoping, design, to implementation
Excellent communication and collaboration skills and ability to communicate complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
We offer an outstanding benefits package to include comprehensive health and dental, unlimited vacation and the best company swag on the block. Lastly, not only will there be ample opportunity grow professionally but you will also be rewarded for the value that you create through your stock options.
Benefits
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home
Free Food & Snacks
Wellness Resources
Stock Option Plan
